title: Is it normal to merely write your name in at the end of an email? - Quora

response.answer_text: Since it's a message to your teacher, I'll assume you don't actually intend to start it with "Hi, you." :) While there's a trend towards extreme informality in email communications, I think it's probably a good idea to close with something like "Respectfully yours". Call me old-fashioned, but I think respect begets respect, and since it's about a previous misunderstanding, it's probably best not to start a new one in the process.
It is fine when writing a non-personal email to not include a closing like "sincerely" or "best regards". I sometimes write "Thank you," but then I'm Canadian. :)
